newsitem.title: FINLAND: ASPO SELLS EX-SOVET UNION RECEIVABLES.
newsitem.headline: ASPO SELLS EX-SOVET UNION RECEIVABLES.

text.p: Finnish metals and engineering group Aspoyhtyma Oy said in a statement on Friday it had sold 51.8 million markka worth of receivables from the former Soviet Union for the same amount of cash.

"Aspo has sold receivables totalling 41.8 million markka from the former Soviet Union to the international capital market and received a corresponding amount in cash," it said, but gave no details of the deal.

The receivables originated from an export delivery, which was put on hold in 1991 due to "payment collection difficulties," it said. Aspo said it had written off the entire amount in the 1992 accounts.

"Because this receivble item was written off earlier, it must be carried as an extraordinary gain in the 1997 accounts and as such will have a posaitive impact on the group's total earnings and equity ratio," Aspo said.
The company's January-April earnings report is due for release on May 29.
